page.title: 10Education
page.content: There are no schools in the area and so all children have to travel,several going to private schools,mostly in Bristol.Children from Winford parish attend Felton or Winford primary schools and Chew Valley comprehensive, the others go to Wrington primary and Churchill comprehensive. Up to 1984 Redhill had a primary school,but this closed because of low numbers.Pupils there were given free transport to Wrington school(nearly 2 miles away),but this was not promised for Redhill children under school age. Parents of pupils starting school in 1985 were told that they would have to pay for this transport.The parents thought that this was unfair as others at Wrington had free transport on road safety grounds.Avon Education cttee agree that the road is dangerous,but still will not provide free transport.
